title: Grade 2
subject: English Language Arts - Extended Learning Standards (2019-)

document.title: Ohio’s Learning Standards – Extended with Learning Progressions English Language Arts

96C1E3613B4D45F3A359579B7357A5E9.description: Actively engage during oral language experiences

B622D2FA586D48A984C4B4FBC6060342.description: analyze words used in oral language experiences

659594CF3B444BAA8C5E884F0855E7AC.description: listen to language for meaning and word types

47A50B99030146E6A2BFE1BE97FC562A.description: chorally respond by saying repeat lines in text

FF47ADDD51C740EDBF805C9C738FC8C8.description: mimic the speech of others in the context of everyday events

F0410D7EA11C4589A4CCB3045572567F.description: select words and phrases that apply to everyday events

CE10C507F8B24B2C99BB70060C5962EB.description: listen to the words and phrases used by peers, adults and in texts

2960C6255C554843B086C062750767B2.description: This one could be used at the c level of complexity or replace the b level of complexity if the extension there is too similar to a.

AC8951F6FE1C4A4D818FD86638C7D074.description: Identify adjectives as words that describe nouns.

BD33A99429F5496E8471289556DB3A1A.description: Identify adjectives used during modeled oral language experiences.

E000F0CD79E44D8687E77C4A43732362.description: Actively participate during activities by interjecting adjectives that have been used during the text or conversation.

4B20C2F3F1D34C3BB3B8CEDDF906284A.description: Use adjectives heard in prior experiences to describe something in a present conversation or activity.

D52366F994504A5F86013677420FADF2.description:
Use words and
phrases acquired through
conversations, reading and
being read to, and responding
to texts, including using
adjectives and adverbs to
describe (e.g., When other
kids are happy that makes me
happy).

8B5EFD520DE347E0AC7525D6358D7781.description: words can be combined into phrases, sentences, paragraphs and books to tell more and more about a topic

A38E6AA1DD0E42408A067E52D3A0EF94.description: words can be used to help others understand us

AE84CA2F219446E88430EF3E09CB16BE.description: words help us understand what others are trying to tell us

74A05B89593A46E6818F4AE710F94F3C.description: words can be used to describe everyday people and places

5E5CAFDE764F4E9BACAD74B55C1775BF.description: adjectives, verbs and nouns can be used to describe other words - attributes

3EE866BD99F14D8D92EFE5E9D3F08854.description: words from categories can be used to write on specific topics

26A7AE7B4F074A89819D211E9600D53E.description: word choice can add detail and intensity to what we speak and write

00B6D123270C49A983C8FAFCAD4ECA30.description: learn that more than one word can be used to convey similar meaning

0A09F6AE07C24C40AA2ECB6EED3A3A08.description:
Select words that describe a familiar event or place. (e.g. grocery store = cart, isle, deli, meats, fruits, vegetables, dairy,
frozen, cooler, express lane, checkout, etc.)

9515BB3D16954F5BBA6AB1C87A6D0164.description: Use words to describe everyday people, places or events.

D0C4EA9716E048F3A8EE65AF3F7539D4.description:
Select a verb with the most appropriate intensity for the situation. (e.g. if shown the blur of a high-speed car in a race the most
appropriate verb might be zoom or speed rather than cruise or coast)

9E3449D434944DD5ACB11956252A9C2D.description:
Demonstrate
understanding of word
relationships and nuances in
word meanings.
a. Identify real-life connections
between words and their
use (e.g., describe foods
that are spicy or juicy).
b. Distinguish shades of
meaning among closely
related verbs (e.g., toss,
throw, hurl) and closely
related adjectives (e.g., thin,
slender, skinny, scrawny).

01A4AE6A935D4EBE8AEB39EDBAB55510.description: Actively engage in word meaning activities

309BA5D3E63D44E3B3E7D3F97D3FC8E6.description: practice dividing compound words during shared reading or everyday events to gain meaning

E2C9178F946D4DB1AAD05919D85E8FF2.description:
identify dictionaries or glossaries as tools to define words, hear pronunciation or words, learn part of speech and see the
syllable breaks

9D034B571597418F9EBFD6B15A3229B1.description: pair words with meaning and concrete examples from everyday life

F00F1B42569447A291234A3493F65A4F.description: identify a root word as a whole word inside a larger word

5AE48EF08D7749AB98EFD45621AD7DB3.description: there are different types of words (compound, past tense, plural, contractions, etc.)

6B99B129C01442ACA0B6AFAFC6C3C091.description: identify that many word parts have meaning

DA78BBB93E5D4121AD05040771354951.description: with modeling and support break words into syllables visually

A513F433C33B44AA94EC3BCBF3404F29.description: with modeling and support break words into syllables orally

7A3C4D5D32494AAFBA5DE00A43D3DD5A.description: Actively participate in word meaning (vocabulary syntax and semantics) activities.

39418F14CDD245D39792322CE8588DA0.description: Identify familiar objects or pictures that represent new 2nd grade words.

063A8E39B7A84A22B88B51C221851D30.description:
Identify parts of common word by breaking the word into syllables orally and attach part to its meaning. (football = ball you
play with your foot; reader - read + person = a person who reads; thirsty - thirst = need a drink)

E26C6FB1B07A410D84DBA90BC236CB45.description:
Use sentence-level context as a clue to determine the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words within grade-level/
age- appropriate text.

ECC9285A0D5546D3AA6B403C5E030761.description:
Determine or clarify
the meaning of unknown and
multiple-meaning words and
phrases
a. based on grade 2 reading and
content, choosing flexibly from
an array of strategies.
b. Use sentence-level context as
a clue to the meaning of a word
or phrase.
c. Determine the meaning of
the new word formed when
a known prefix is added to
a known word (e.g., happy/
unhappy, tell/retell).
d. Use a known root word as
a clue to the meaning of an
unknown word with the same
root (e.g., addition, additional).
e. Use knowledge of the meaning
of individual words to predict
the meaning of compound
words (e.g., birdhouse,
lighthouse, housefly; bookshelf,
notebook, bookmark).
f. Use glossaries and beginning
dictionaries, both print and
digital, to determine or clarify
the meaning of words and
phrases.

377B8E3BCC864270931CDC33315C3F87.description: Communicate with others using both formal and informal communications.

E46654350FAC4834BEC97573CB2750C0.description: Identify informal language when given an example and non-example.

9556D2F61925416B8B18FF1362F5793C.description: Identify formal English when given an example and non-example.

AD5944FACC0F4255A1EF39C4E132305D.description: Identify when it is acceptable to use informal communications.

D805DE78FF8A4788BD606B2C97B0B689.description: Identify when to use formal communications.

E95499494B2A4FD4831F254BFFDCF036.description:
Select appropriate communication from a set of choices to match situation. (text message, writing a letter, talking to a friend,
presenting to the class, etc.)

F2A97A387BAD45B6B689DE0A847CEA7B.description:
Use knowledge of
language and its conventions
when writing, speaking,
reading, or listening.
a. Recognize formal and
informal uses of English.
b. Compare formal and
informal uses of English.

9264C6EC49CB47049187BF80A5ABD096.description: Actively engage during phonics / spelling and writing activities.

570F57C42ED24C028D01847577967C67.description: match letter sounds in simple words to letter tiles or letter shapes

77E57FE0EDB54944AA40D802905EA1DA.description: match sounds in simple words to placeholders for letters (Elkonin boxes with chips)

33F5CAA96C8C4BFCB5B90FC27E987C08.description: say or identify each of the consonant sounds (most commonly used)

12E04B39F2FA4818B550170AAD6DD868.description: say or identify each of the short vowel sounds

CD73CEC1368E492EA42B97551419B23B.description: identify letters as sounds in speech and writing

82FBA20B39E3418DB9B117DA9D2DF21D.description: identify one or more reasons we capitalize words

9756CC3787D54FEFB725BB0FB65C9296.description: match punctuation mark with sentence type

CB04CFA10B064D16AFEA9CC28DB9884D.description: identify a sentence as beginning with a capital letter and ending with punctuation

61349EDBBCAD405E970028AD013388C4.description: Identify capital letters at the beginning of familiar names (e.g., own, classmates’ or family members’).

BB24E7ABD7924F82843D171B2ADE555C.description: Identify capitalization and ending punctuation within a written sentence.

45052A4B88CA44AE976D10F32EF556A2.description:
Demonstrate command
of the conventions of standard
English capitalization,
punctuation, and spelling
when writing.
a. Capitalize holidays, product
names, and geographic
names.
b. Use commas in greetings
and closings of letters.
c. Use an apostrophe to form
contractions and frequently
occurring possessives.
d. Generalize learned spelling
patterns when writing words
(e.g., cage -> badge; boy ->
boil).
e. Consult reference materials,
including beginning
dictionaries, as needed to
check and correct spellings.

78F73A7086CC45BDB0665B2B93F2CB86.description: use adjectives in oral and written communication

83A0B74B9C3A44778EA26BB9EE8BE471.description: orally practice changing a noun from singular to plural

CA5AA423A4164E80A3BA7D38CBC38F69.description: group nouns by type - people, places, things

D70E687B7BE144DD9C1464D6306DF256.description: use names of people as use of nouns

D771B46F0B314A268983C5AEC50F8CEE.description: identify nouns as people, places or things

279561F67D9D4BB691E317AC044F2F4E.description: Select and/or use nouns during communication opportunities (both speaking and writing)

15B1AB5EC76F483C86DAABA79A5BD59D.description: Select and/or use expanded nouns (pronouns, plural nouns) during communication opportunities (both speaking and writing)

2BF1D73F7C2F47FFA6C5B4BFC28772D0.description:
Select and/or use nouns, verbs and adjectives to create simple sentences during communication opportunities (both speaking
and writing)

7AAFDA75768746FA87D8FA142B492ED3.description:
Demonstrate command
of the conventions of standard
English grammar and usage
when writing or speaking.
a. Use collective nouns (e.g.,
group).
b. Form and use frequently
occurring irregular plural
nouns (e.g., feet, children,
teeth, mice, fish).
c. Use reflexive pronouns
(e.g., myself, ourselves).
d. Form and use the past
tense of frequently
occurring irregular verbs
(e.g., sat, hid, told).
e. Use adjectives and adverbs,
and choose between them
depending on what is to be
modified.
f. Produce, expand, and
rearrange complete simple
and compound sentences
(e.g., The boy watched
the movie; The little boy
watched the movie; The
action movie was watched
by the little boy).

3FDE6CC9C7FE4439A92672C809B238C6.description: Communicate using any mode of communication.

90FAC76032F043F8BF7AB99AD1AC6BD1.description: Communicate using tools needed for communication.

ACA4DD74FEDD4D868132967280DF18AB.description: Communicate using single words, symbols, gestures, facial expressions, sign language, voice output, etc.

4FC343394B0A454790F1C036530287A5.description: Communicate in complete sentences in a manner appropriate to a task or situation.

72AE8E003856427EAE014E2FC5C89546.description: Communicate to add details or clarify.

E4743D824E6D498F9D34C06C9F23BA8D.description:
Produce complete
sentences when appropriate
to task and situation in order
to provide requested detail or
clarification.

656D0F8D66564552BBED9AA63192C37D.description: Choose visuals or audio related to a story or experience.

ED40CD76DCBB4052A98F6F67C49B1B82.description: Add visuals or audio to enhance a story or description of a personal experience.

C2E80649347C4061A987F99C82E2CF47.description: Add visuals or audio to enhance a presentation and clarify details.

721E64833044472B9CBBB4FAEC1FD4E4.description:
Create audio
recordings of stories or
poems; add drawings or other
visual displays to stories or
recounts of experiences when
appropriate to clarify ideas,
thoughts, and feelings.

681D2E296E314854BB2E008B5893FE3B.description: Actively engage when a personal experience is presented.

03C76346AE904040847147301833B766.description: Select a familiar topic (person place, thing, or event) for discussion.

30145F932D4D4099AFD7CB14EB65C066.description: Express feelings about a familiar topic (person, place, thing, or event).

15E4DF35DAF54187842018A2CC474F51.description: Actively engage with familiar people in familiar places, with familiar things, during familiar events.

B2793723F076431291429BBF2A7A5927.description: Actively participate in selection of familiar people, things, events places with which to interact.

49AB284A15B5401DA3233E36B88D8BE0.description: participate in autobiography (All About Me) activities

B236D007D7B84342B87423571D00A259.description: share about familiar things during show and tell

22007DBE316A493E91D87DE753B01723.description: share personal experiences in a journal or share time

204230600D0B44AF9AAFF971A1000154.description:
create a circles graph referencing people who are personal friends or family members and others who are acquaintances or
strangers

207D4BE55AA64995A90411F854607B61.description: participate in interest inventories/surveys about preferences

AE467A9286534BBBB40B3393A521D573.description: Communicate in an understandable mode with the intent of being understood by others.

A4ECA8A3388A4A348C1A39CC2D4C190F.description: Communicate clearly about a personal experience including relevant details

BC0D3BFD1018402299715A6F60D82DB3.description: Communicate using one or more sentences to recount an experience.

C406DC2AA6E94D2BB8761974F439350E.description:
Tell a story or
recount an experience
with appropriate facts and
relevant, descriptive details,
speaking audibly in coherent
sentences.

DE7CB14FA7A047B8A4D7D484DA88648C.description: Actively engage with others to get attention.

CCAFAE31A54848639DD59E463F3DE3E9.description: Seek opportunities for purposeful interactions with others

798CFD1D102D4703869D196933E90CC8.description: Establish a mode of communication that flexibly includes age-appropriate topics and skills

CA3B3E64A5784C69A52AFFF8566493A2.description: Establish a mode of communication that is understood by others

15F596752AEB41F2A95622519EB25F63.description: Actively engage with others to get their attention in order to share an idea, thought or question.

01FB491D45E84C83846BB90A76D02453.description: Repeat communication attempt (possibly using different modes) until understood by others or until question is answered.

B22BF08B2D24458B8023D4B95B448C55.description: Ask or answer questions to clarify understanding or gain information about a topic

B8A7080FDA31460695D02B2C55E9B82E.description:
Ask and answer
questions about what a
speaker says in order to
clarify comprehension, gather
additional information, or
deepen understanding of a
topic or issue.

F61D453894BC4D56A366BFAB19D21736.description: Actively engage with information presented in a variety of formats, including text.

BD1BED55087F4F9BBE356B04DCB43BC6.description: Sort information by accurate/inaccurate, key details/extra information

1DA0A02C50514E809C056CEDD76AE2A1.description: Answer the question: Is all information accurate or important?

B87536E9B9694303809EA8810CCF7C41.description: brainstorm how can we share information with others

7FD23D3E2FF44965B241AA7693A011C9.description: discuss how we can remember information that we find

0BDCD85977F242D49DA4AC3124F8E821.description: identify when would we need to find information

476EEA8D36604677AA73D6F0238A6AD0.description: identify where we can look for information

2EE354589A524FE5BE3BC07A2F46E9C8.description: Identify a variety of sources used to gain information. (books, magazines, news, videos, online, etc.)

C2A6B91A0FEB44A6B1308DD7DE9E34CB.description: Communicate appropriately to express feelings or ideas.

8DFB2D10CD1A42B7B04B86617B310CA2.description: Recall topic or idea from information presented in text or media.

813242F40BE341C89E2F67145B731751.description:
Note: Many learners have a high interest in videos and other media. Expanding this beyond oral presentation not only
captures interest but also expands access for learners who might need closed captions or alternate formats.

761FAEEB78CE4E47ACF9D800C8463339.description: Describe two or more key ideas or details from text read aloud or information presented in other media formats

24B1A61E393C488CB9414AD823BCAC43.description:
Retell or describe key
ideas or details from a text
read aloud or information
presented in various media
and other formats (e.g.,
orally).

8F3242FCCE054E0F926B446E34105B85.description: Actively participate in conversation about 2nd grade appropriate topics or text.

38672DD49D92414FA0C731ADFFEF4F29.description: Continue a conversation through multiple exchanges.

168E569022FF442EADBD9026FF8AABF2.description: Follow agreed upon rules (e.g., gaining attention, listening to others, turn-taking

44CCA61EC57F4F138098F474E6BFAADB.description: Actively participate in supported conversations about 2nd grade appropriate topics and text.

6AECB58F2DF24FFAA75C6A6A5CE1B932.description: Follow agreed upon rules (e.g., gaining attention, listening to others, turn-taking

9144965DEF37473599DDB12D82C8480E.description: Participate in group discussions about 2nd grade appropriate topics and text.

05E3E58D637B408EA1CB8033C755B0AF.description:
Participate in
collaborative conversations
with diverse partners about
grade 2 topics and texts with
peers and adults in small and
larger groups.
a. Follow agreed-upon
rules for discussions
(e.g., gaining the floor in
respectful ways, listening to
others with care, speaking
one at a time about the
topics and texts under
discussion).
b. Build on others’ talk in
conversations by linking
their comments to the
remarks of others.
c. Ask for clarification and
further explanation as
needed about the topics
and texts under discussion.

017432BAD19B45FF8486C1061DFB2EF4.description: Engage in question and answer exchanges.

6F7034D1835145A3B6739A4F1BACACCA.description: Identify information to answer a question in a provided source (printed passage, sentence, paragraph, movie clip, book, etc.).

177059E256D047638DDA90B79515D558.description:
Use information from personal experiences or other sources (i.e. Provided sources: text, digital media, social interactions) to
answer questions.

6007B053C6EB493BBD1E73238CBE5FEE.description:
Recall information
from experiences or gather
information from provided
sources to answer a question.

91A482CCB6BB4FEAB0AE0E0D75DCEDCC.description: Participate in a shared experience to contribute to group writing.

82C3BBAEC4974AE095AEA28E035DE60D.description: Select two or more books on the same topic to use during shared research.

37092E5BF4F6406BB8E1D3B1BAF96BCC.description: Identify two or more details about a topic that were learned during shared research.

8F7B3C0613BB44EBA87499C5E178C3D8.description: Participate in shared research and add details to shared writing experiences.

4921E2B6B1384F30AE85EF5D5B6687BE.description: Record one or more details from shared research into shared writing.

4DA5F440C6C6478BBE5E72C65103EB59.description:
Participate in shared
research and writing projects
(e.g., read a number of books
on a single topic to produce
a report; record science
observations).

7382D5CA9B164278A155DBB66E4F31D2.description:
Research to Build and
Present Knowledge

3185F228D8A7434984DF9A0265A610A7.description: Engage in using digital tools, including assistive technologies

22B1B0ADEF2A4E29BA3ED04FAFB5766B.description: Use digital tools to capture communicated ideas, thoughts and feelings.

69FBB357F0B74763AABF9B34C08C7F43.description: Further develop (organize and add details), a communicated idea for the purpose of writing and publishing.

64A56E20C8C040D69B19F5ED9507E055.description: With guidance and support, select and use digital tools to produce and publish writing.

1E441A13DB4942818568F436CD0612F7.description:
With guidance and
support from adults, use
a variety of digital tools to
produce and publish writing,
including in collaboration with
peers.

2C1EA4EE38D94E9F86910C8791CAC224.description: With guidance and support, select details to strengthen writing.

8FB805C7D9BE42F79C2101057E72716D.description: With guidance and support, add one or more details to strengthen writing.

1CD41358BE2643C4A874A899F1F8FDDE.description: With guidance and support, revise writing to maintain focus on a topic.

46FA24A6EFDC492490410DEC10E8A2F7.description:
With guidance and
support from adults and
peers, focus on a topic and
strengthen writing as needed
by revising and editing.

601A4CE4B2544C4AAAF8B048A288F08E.description: Engage in events that could be described in writing.

91AAA0B46BBF4FA1A48618B17FED8D52.description: Identify actions, thoughts and feelings about a topic.

FF4D671F28734F1FBD226E5E08BD6D4F.description: Arrange pictures or text to communicate a sequence of events that tell a story.

D491C690E14B414CA58617BA11A7B6B1.description: Generate text to communicate a sequence of events that tell a story.

72E14879956F45A3BE1518F3502A1822.description: Include temporal words within text to suggest order of events.

C96076F6B4CA44AAB2F23BC9D97CB279.description: Include words in writing that signal closure.

7E2A3D51C9B64F9E907FC3419DB97F13.description:
Write narratives in
which they recount a well-elaborated event or short
sequence of events, include
details to describe actions,
thoughts, and feelings, use
temporal words to signal
event order, and provide a
sense of closure.

2D6550B8F08E495686ADB07C9F3F17EF.description: Engage in communication that could be captured for writing.

5A34C1E53AB248D6BC16AEF975872509.description: Generate at least one fact about a topic.

28E97057F8CE45AB9E06695FDC8D8D5B.description: Generate written text about a topic, and provide one fact about the topic.

ECAEEE4366644960AF5E885FA0143AE5.description: (Topic) is ____ but the important thing about _(topic)_ is _____.)

EFF9AA0F4B214CF1BB6FFE7CE614E142.description:
Communicate/select/write to fill in a template that includes a topic sentence, closing statement and one or more supporting
facts. (e.g. The important thing about _(Topic)_is _________.

EE20DD910E6549F6AAD3989A2D7E52F9.description:
Write informative/
explanatory texts in which
they introduce a topic, use
facts and definitions to
develop points, and provide
a concluding statement or
section.

651776053C32482FA1F09F8049F9365E.description: Engage in conversations where opinions are shared.

74170E6FF837429687EFD67FDF330CE0.description: Communicate a personal opinion about a topic or book.

7B19E71EAAFF4A968C35A42E1D0598F6.description: Generate written text stating a basic opinion on a topic.

8E73B24E699A40FB80B5A03319D8AD9A.description: Generate written text stating a basic opinion on a topic, and provide a reason musing the linking word “because”.

F30EFEF59A0A445F8F7B791721A95595.description: Use linking words such as and, also to add additional reasons to support an opinion in writing.

BD9DD2FCCFE945F89DAB6F9FE8CB9B56.description: Include a concluding statement in writing.

BFD5C4ABAAEB48CFB5DE8C57876DE9A9.description:
Write opinion pieces
in which they introduce the
topic or book they are writing
about, state an opinion,
supply reasons that support
the opinion, use linking words
(e.g., because, and, also) to
connect opinion and reasons,
and provide a concluding
statement or section.

9550250C2E4644ACA97C8C84BD206050.description: Note: see RL.2.10 and RI.2.10 and all RF standards for additional skills in this sequence.

F57EF4987DE74E8B922C47CE1A3BBEA2.description: Engage with letters representing first sounds in words

669CD5BC312944C59926C5464B458BB5.description: Actively engage with letters, sounds, and words.

0BCD2D70146D4142ACD4DF321738A676.description: Actively participate in supported grade-level/age-appropriate, adapted texts.

A22073DD24B64420992644B09454653D.description: Demonstrate foundational knowledge in phonological/phonemic awareness

971AB0EF589E4244BA438536059D14DF.description:
Articulate all letter sounds accurately with increasing automaticity until fluent (each sound symbol correspondence within 1
second)

1C5F549380654582BDC3F513B88CF93F.description: Demonstrate letter-sound knowledge with increasing automaticity

7E7F4AB6698C4D07B3E1ED38E06BA637.description: Represent sound for each letter in alphabet with automaticity

DB01D49500A2407B84001CAD27F45D5D.description: Stretch spoken words by individual sounds then state or select the whole word.

B4F0A3F769CD4E678B0F06DCEA44496D.description:
Decode words by saying all sounds in the word represented by letter symbols with increasing automaticity until fluent (within 1
second)

E9378BFBCC3242F5AC35486810CBA4F3.description: Decode predictable short vowels with automaticity and fluency

2DFB7FC8D6DC4A60A721096F52DA11C9.description: Decode CVC words with automaticity and fluency

CA4F3EA2D991478493F6C441F9FB59BA.description: Use decoding skills to self-correct, rereading word as necessary

61183FCC1D1242B9B04809598C9769E6.description: Use context to confirm or self-correct word recognition, rereading as necessary.

CFD14967544D426BB5C25B0C374217C8.description: A word has as many syllables as it has vowel sounds.

0494795D98DF412E8C9AFDD310C49D19.description: Orally break up a given word into syllables

12E1C9AEC6E8468392A0377388C3EC87.description: Identify syllables within a printed word

0965D95640204EADB7378779824FA6BE.description: Break words into syllables to support decoding multi-syllable words.

FAB0AC1FB4F4474C81E1D85E4104B625.description: Demonstrate the spelling-sound correspondences during decoding

26FE5D1934374259A4897408A64F43FF.description: Identify irregularly spelled words that are not spelled as they sound (e.g., above, country, again).

36CF95E75F134FB4A0CB635A2CA3132A.description: Decode specific common vowel teams represent long vowel sounds (e.g., ai, oa, ee).

5B11191AD4D241B08519EA583224FB8C.description: Read grade-level text orally with increased accuracy and fluency on successive readings.

BC6BEEEC88A14248950D6A56C47B5729.description: Read grade-level text with fluency to support understanding.

B43E27067BAC479D8E009AB7406F775C.description:
Read with sufficient
accuracy and fluency to
support comprehension.
a. Read grade-level text with
purpose and understanding.
b. Read grade-level text orally
with accuracy, appropriate
rate, and expression on
successive readings.
c. Use context to confirm or
self-correct word recognition
and understanding,
rereading as necessary.

E5B6C3A0A9EA4F50B460107501D5CB0A.description: Read common high frequency words by sight (e.g., the, of, to, you, she, my, is, are, do, does).

47D5F6D770D44E28B5686508BEA55095.description: Associate the long and short sounds with common spellings for the five major vowels.

C238B7A4304C4F4A8A551DB240C0C012.description: Decode two-syllable words following basic patterns by breaking the words into syllables.

3E801CE269E144B990995B8C657568C9.description: Apply letter-sound knowledge (e.g., recognize sound of first letter of own name, recognize own name).

9CF21FC5A5A545458535B1EB95B56BF8.description: Note: Referencing “Speech to Print” research by Louisa Moats

C45181F3F4E94E79BA0D3968771677E9.description: Match speech sounds to printed consonant letters.

0C3A8E7F571446AAA705B869CB3541A4.description: Identify letter-sound association at the beginning of words

AB0EB047C2424487A5CD67731BF4E7D7.description:
Know and apply
grade-level phonics and word
analysis skills in decoding
words.
a. Distinguish long and short
vowels when reading
regularly spelled one-syllable words.
b. Know spelling-sound
correspondences for
additional common vowel
teams.
c. Decode regularly spelled
two-syllable words with long
vowels.
d. Decode words with common
prefixes and suffixes.
e. Identify words with
inconsistent but
common spelling-sound
correspondences.
f. Recognize and read grade-appropriate irregularly
spelled words.

28DE39BD216946A5870F4F15142328B8.description: Engage with informational text written at the second grade level.

9EE2109DF9F24A35996FA2B2741ADA50.description: Actively engage with sounds, letters, words, phrases, sentences, within grade-level literature.

C5C0D014F2E7490A941B8160EE638816.description:
Actively engage in activities using orally presented and text-based 2nd grade-level, age-appropriate, informational texts,
across all subject areas using scaffolding and adaptations as needed.

41E6C76763674F0DADEE62361DD18427.description:
Actively participate in comprehension activities using 2nd grade-level, age-appropriate, informational texts, across all subject
areas using scaffolding and adaptations as needed.

9E9453C9261E4F83BDA316DF8A32156D.description: Match 26 letters to most common sounds while decoding.

280CCD79D68C47D49D0589F90637F2BA.description: Demonstrate knowledge of 26 letter sounds by decoding 2 letter sound combinations in 2 letter words

738D8957F1044A65987EF075FB6C2A02.description: With prompting and support decode and read CVC words within a grade level text.

3DF44ED4E13846E5AF90C41ED318F2EB.description: Demonstrate knowledge of 26 letter sounds by combining 2 consonant sounds into consonant blends

180419EA456D43E3A312F556A6FB5ACE.description: Combine 2-3 consonants that make one sound. (i.e., th, sh, ch, wh, ph, gh, tch)

AB512BB671B048F2B7BACA88E3BB109B.description: With prompting and support decode and read CCVC words within a grade-level decodable text.

B4F3BE18CAFF4C5BA343C3ADF981BDF7.description:
Demonstrate knowledge of 26 letter sounds by decoding CVCC (includes: floss rule, blends), CCVCC (includes: g /j/ & c /s/
onsets), CCCVC, CCCVCC (includes: beginning blends & trigraphs)

0A7C6F0E02F2470F9733CA7F5A093AF9.description:
Demonstrate knowledge of 26 letter sounds by decoding 3-6 letter sound combinations in 4-6 letter words. (CVCC (floss rule),
CCVCC, CCCVC, CCCVCC)

98A7A831EB8C4956BDC4A1E1E709D613.description: With prompting and support decode and read CVCC, CCVCC, CCCVC, CCCVCC words within a grade-level decodable text.

34048BC2B8574164926B98210C47FC99.description: Increase automatic recall of newly learned sound/symbol correspondences for the purposes of decoding and reading.

82D26785331D4A97AF182FE7E16BD5A8.description: Increase automatic recall of high frequency words - building the number of sight word recall from beginning to end of year.

FC472F4490004E2381E1ADC16D71D886.description: Engage with informational texts, including history/social

DB2F3F93479C41D4887452FB4C72E086.description: Decode and read simple informational text..

F0E4B017890D407A85C4BF72FB66284C.description:
Answer wh- questions related to grade-level/age appropriate informational texts, including history/social studies, science, and
technical texts.

24E97797A141451684075EBFE065F74C.description:
By the end of year,
read and comprehend
informational texts, including
history/social studies, science,
and technical texts, in the
grades 2–3 text complexity
band proficiently, with
scaffolding as needed at the
high end of the range. By
the end of year, listen to or
read, and comprehend 2nd
grade-level, age-appropriate,
informational texts, across
all subject areas using
scaffolding and adaptations
as needed.

5A0C25E9597B4E91B4BB54C7AF44C5F7.description:
Range of Reading and Level
of Text Complexity

87E2148CC1AA4AFFAC5D76A214429C68.description: Actively engages during the sharing of two informational texts on the same topic.

5C9BE919C5074DCA9DD5C5E4AD2C181C.description: Identify the similarities in two texts that address the same topic.

910B306C70F14238A9E54A29B29DCD04.description: Identify two texts that have similar topics.

3D05BB2C0288435FB2F904C919EBEA5C.description: Identify similarities as being the same or alike, but not identical.

B194B398C1D14F5DA26B10B424D70307.description: Procedures refers to a series of steps that build on one another and lead to an outcome.

5D5A93CAB4854E1CB7F9A6ECFC1DDB48.description: Descriptions refers to an account that includes all the relevant features or characteristics.

CD9F76AD7EE346A3BA5FF362E1A9C869.description: Illustrations refers to the pictures, drawings, or visual aids that provide a visual representation of some part of the text.

2BF73123ED65445DBEB57C228570CE1A.description: Topic refers to a subject or focus of a text.

861856A9BEE54348ADB5AC13CEC25AFF.description: Identify basic differences between two texts on the same topic (e.g., in illustrations, descriptions, or procedures).

AE51D6C1232242F89A2C86C356476387.description: Given the most important points from two passages on the same topic, compare to find the similarities.

1BB1458ABE254C54A7F4C157779ABAD7.description: Given the most important points from two passages on the same topic, contrast to find the differences.

2FFCC2FA05D14DD4B7D351AF71653C09.description:
Compare and contrast
the most important points
presented by two texts on the
same topic.

D21E8F0C7CA747529D83B35CFEB06881.description: Actively engage in shared informational text that contains a topic of interest.

FFB2177FC86E4E1194E151E3A2C51778.description: Identify one or more reasons/facts an author gives to support their own words in written text.

29CFF1D74A524A22B846E6FC3E625011.description: Identify that authors of informational texts use proven facts to support their own words.

F907315E38B6430E9DF710A3E6F9043B.description: Identify that authors of informational texts write using facts.

F0E35519CEC04CEA84E9BB39DBB6E840.description: identify that facts are proven points of information

2A654BE76A1E479985ACC91ED0C4FF85.description: identify the difference between fact and fiction

E32D1BABDA6648F59005575C9B24A050.description: Match one of the author’s topics to one or more supporting detail from the text.

B2D673B1373F48A9B10C4114C551E0C2.description: Identify one or more topics the author writes about in a text.

9C533B8E2687470FBC7F373FC7C0158A.description: Indicate the author who wrote a given text.

642CDE3BC30E46E48DA5208CCF510CF3.description: Indicate the author’s name or picture on/in a given text.

AB55C6926404458DA4DB81B5709AD281.description: Points refers to ideas, opinions, or claims.

0C30963C0EF84261AF8A2B273B3610E1.description: Author refers to a person who presents ideas or information in written form.

589E1FA455E44011B80DC2C44F66E55A.description: Reasons refers to causes or explanations.

B6BD347C8E764216A16C99AF30F3B56F.description: Identify refers to recognizing and/or naming.

CB2FC813AAE1452489665807837F044E.description: Identify the topic of a text.

68E6DFBCFFCB4F60955399998A35C7FA.description: Identify key points in a text.

92D8630335E1463FA3E66B7135C8F067.description: Locate a reason/detail that supports the author’s point in a text.

021799132D3F4C399FD16451F9BAEC30.description:
Identify the main points
an author uses in a text and,
with support, explain how
reasons connect to the main
points.

1BA4312310814CFBAA2A1C2B928BAA93.description: Actively engage in shared informational text that contains illustrations.

A261ABF8E8BA4584A9C355C639CF7F4F.description: Distinguish between print and illustrations in informational text.

725A6F6EDFA64D34BA6EBC33A27C2CA4.description: Point out matching keywords in both text and illustrations.

9A5190582AD049C88860BEAC232DBF01.description: Listen for, and indicate when, information that matches a given illustration from a text.

0E78CF15DAE34E3F8D330F9057CF09C1.description: indicate when text matches visual supports in text

6BEA40D2AB9C4CE9A32B67DA36A268BE.description: Match ideas found in illustrations to those found in text.

6DDDEC89A8F2422C95E9E1BBFDB1EC14.description: Identify a detail(s) found in images/diagrams that is/are not present in the text.

2200C99050AE4134AE1DE8A876EA305F.description: Describe the relationship between illustrations and the story in which they appear.

795626D3F4894F5DB71F59A310481910.description:
Explain how specific
images (e.g., a diagram
showing how a machine
works) contribute to and
clarify a text.

E071D0E6FCDE4ACDB51C61170C13C59F.description: Actively engage in shared informational text.

8188A49863804F15A54D28E80645537A.description: distinguish between information provided by pictures or other illustrations and information provided by the words in a text.

AAC1A66ED276464BB7B95FE5C7728E6F.description: Define the illustrator’s role in presenting the ideas or information in a text.

DD6FFB7F42204046BF567040DA472815.description: Name the illustrator of a text.

78B46E8D9AD14E288DDD272BD75968BB.description: Define the author’s role in presenting the ideas or information in a text.

9216EDEC7F6A466286ABDD724FF1015A.description: Name the author of a text.

AFF709D83510401CA511F5A7601B9AF9.description: Identify the topic(s) the author has chosen to write about from the title, table of contents or chapter content.

154C9189CB7042FFA3480DCA7DD7E78D.description: Review the pictures or other illustrations in a text to identify meaning or additional information about the author’s chosen topic.

C4DE346F8BD44345AF0603C21B63E7A2.description: Identify the main purpose of an informational text.

A246B39C23A44AE59E2085E2252D1284.description:
Identify the main
purpose of a text, including
what the author wants to
answer, explain, or describe.

36D48D0F5977452B8408516737C51E45.description: Actively engage in the handling of a book

386B6934F41B4678B51A69FF12A14D23.description: match the table of contents with the back of the book

8B9CC5A0F3374D1FAC2EFA55841A3907.description: match the glossary with the front of the book

1F759E6DA9EE4082B629891128197A48.description: identify large or bold text as important text features (possibly headings, key terms, titles, etc.)

C17A6895A07F482A9FD4B6AC46D0B46F.description: identify page numbers in a text

6F034E7F924F47DB9367C484A34E0601.description: indicate the author of a book

692F995731C94A9B8F9BC27447C436E2.description: indicate the title of the book

6EE8897D07194E70B13146A95DCC264E.description: identify the pictures in a book

528163302F6E425984EE43FFC487548C.description: identify the pictures in a book

36DF251214054F61BA6812748D5D19E6.description: indicate the pages in a book

C93E2B558D9A408E913D8656EB46E177.description: indicate the cover of the book

F437B6321B6A4463B85CC900941697D6.description: turn pages in a book moving from front to back

C7E18831CD4146BC8151A32489668096.description: Identify a table of contents as a map or outline of the text - a place to find page numbers for specific information.

3EB9E65EF3084D16829CB3B79554E572.description: Identify a glossary as a place to find definitions and possibly page numbers for keywords in a text.

6285148414FA44AEB7818CDBAADE28E3.description: Use text features (e.g., heading, table of contents, glossaries) to locate specific information in a text.

8FB99CE6A85D4631BF6A7BA2F9985F51.description:
Know and use various
text features (e.g., captions,
bold print, subheadings,
glossaries, indexes, electronic
menus, icons) to locate key
facts or information in a text
efficiently.

8E637FC2C4B740C98031D2C29528C931.description:
Actively engage with objects, tactile graphics or other sensory experiences related to better understand the meaning of words
in a text.

10E83DB221CE4E8291FAEBF1A868ADA4.description: Actively engage during Q & A about informational text vocabulary.

9C65A28BE3CF437F993528F38E15A767.description:
use word study strategies from all brain processors (phonology, orthography, phonics, semantics and syntax) to develop word
meaning (break word into onset and rime, break word into syllables, morphemes, break word into phonemes, word origin, part
of speech, etc.)

031486E7082542D5888A81AA14E8A350.description: identify that a word is more than its name by sight - it has meaning

9C579F8EDA6C4D6DA9E86A33996BE576.description:
practice the use of word strategies (break word into onset and rime, break word into syllables, morphemes, break word into
phonemes, word origin, part of speech, context, use a dictionary ask questions, etc.) to determine meaning

F279B89A8AD6483880F9C94394794703.description: Ask questions about unknown word to determine its meaning.

7EA399E55D2745E7A19BC0D8F7E9A5B2.description: Identify the meaning of words based on how they are used in a text.

AB73989FF42043C081D06184E59B3D9C.description: Use a word study strategy to describe the meaning of words in a text.

D4123F45EAF3415B95CDD666293FA76A.description:
Determine the meaning
of words and phrases in a text
relevant to a grade 2 topic or
subject area.

F4B507B39F2C4601B9C46DF8941A0345.description:
Look for or identify language that pertains to cause/effect (e.g., what happened, why, because, as a result of) is used to
describe a relationship.

E31EAB6F0E49437BA0C9F4379199E4EE.description: Order events according to language that pertains to time (e.g. before, after, then, first) is used to describe a point in time.

59476448B22249249B0B035ADDE9E09C.description: Sequence the order or arrangement of objects or events, one coming after the other.

4115191C548B4BB89BC179CFBBFDFEAE.description:
Learn that a cause/effect relationship refers to one that notes the reasons for and/or the consequences of an action, event, or
decision.

ED01EEA6319541CE92C016269CC93317.description: Learn that relationship refers to the way in which two items are connected.

FCD9D7D354A6446ABE64674C664BEF79.description: Identify two events, ideas, individuals or steps in procedures from a text.

9071FEBF23BF46BCAC838F8214EFBE47.description: Describe two events, ideas, individuals or steps in procedures from a text.

36F9D60F0F8A400AA6CA4B35872F5519.description:
Describe the
connection between a series
of historical events, scientific
ideas or concepts, or steps in
technical procedures in a text.

89EC5540C7724B088ABD27D6C2876E2A.description: identify an informational text vs. literature

768EDCD747B3468780ED17E66CDFE8E7.description: Identify the main topic and the focus of two or more paragraphs.

78B5C523BF07439C942755ABD9D767DD.description:
Analyze informational
text development.
a. Identify the main topic of a
multi-paragraph text.
b. Identify the focus of specific
paragraphs within the text.

E4039C64209A41DA927CDDE4CA4E5E43.description: Actively engage with someone who is asking a question.

A2191CA9D0124439A121FB6B1391EC1B.description: Actively engage with shared informational text.

1340A59B6F1C48CFB12DAA75E741CAC4.description: associate where questions with geographic location

4469E2BA3D8F4467900D9D3647D37B63.description: Answer who or what questions to demonstrate understanding of informational text.

F1AE74A5E8F7424986DE6407E37BE7F4.description: Ask and answer who, what, where, when, why and how questions to demonstrate understanding of informational text.

A63A0F8230BF4568AC49F6A1B543FE78.description:
Ask and answer such
questions as who, what,
where, when, why, and how to
demonstrate understanding of
key details in a text.

5C33DE0392D740EDBB314C40BCE3AE17.description: Actively engage with sounds letters, words, phrase, sentences, within grade-level literature.

C9BCDBE66E9E415AA27424BBB0CC2091.description: Actively engage with sounds, letters, words, phrases, sentences, within grade-level literature.

DF814E64C6D14D94A7D5B31CCB7A8D8A.description: Combine 2-3 consonants that make one sound. (i.e., th, sh, ch, wh, ph, gh, tch)

3D71113BE8354C8785E78575D572EC22.description: Demonstrate knowledge of 26 letter sounds by building 3-4 letter sound combinations in 4 letter words (CCVC words)

5EB91AEDFA1E4A9183FDC1B03DE7900D.description: With prompting and support decode and read CCVC words within a grade-level decodable text.

2749D616A287499FAC0C374750517ABF.description:
Demonstrate knowledge of 26 letter sounds by building CVCC (includes: floss rule, blends), CCVCC (includes: g /j/ & c /s/
onsets), CCCVC, CCCVCC (includes: beginning blends & trigraphs)

F5E0D4C777ED4A6CB11C9493B3B32FBB.description:
Demonstrate knowledge of 26 letter sounds by building 3-6 letter sound combinations in 4-6 letter words. (CVCC (floss rule),
CCVCC, CCCVC, CCCVCC)

0AA990DF9BB943698D28AE5460F4009B.description: With prompting and support decode and read CVCC, CCVCC, CCCVC, CCCVCC words within a grade-level decodable text.

7A5717C49E0B420AABDAD4C1B9FC6BA1.description: Increase automatic recall of newly learned sound/symbol correspondences for the purposes of decoding and reading.

E573A9D6345A4FB28CE95156936E2201.description: Increase automatic recall of high frequency words - building the number of sight word recall from beginning to end of year.

44F8C8872B294DE4B96966DB5EFC6A9F.description: Engage with text types including poetry and stories.

1B690C3BA15341CD82D9DABAE5ABEDE6.description: Decode and read simple poems and stories.

02DF09BC130C40F9A0688A443C48B9D4.description:
By the end of the
year, read and comprehend
literature, including stories
and poetry, in the grades
2–3 text complexity band
proficiently, with scaffolding as
needed at the high end of the
range.
Activate prior knowledge and
draw on previous experiences
in order to make text-to-self or
text-to-text connections and
comparisons.

6341C35BADDF4E33980DB87BFAE0C5C8.description:
Range of Reading and Level
of Text Complexity

CCD8D78181254633A4D5F8546EB53226.description: identify the author of a story

3F77F92887F6421FB06A8397299FA9CF.description: Describe similarities/compare or differences/contrast in two or more versions of a story.

D70CAA22EDD44BA59A337944E4D8DA32.description:
Compare and contrast
two or more versions of the
same story (e.g., Cinderella
stories) by different authors or
from different cultures.

28758F9ED31E42E0B2E15DD7C3E3CB9D.description: Actively engage with illustrations or words in a print or digital text.

F121D1C770F34F37A1BAD89C58BA23D4.description: indicate elements of character, setting or plot in a picture from a text

A83975E00D534BF79D95701EB6D85A70.description: describe what is happening in a given illustration

EF684D7E2D5C41D58CCAB19E71A7BA6C.description: identify setting as the place(s)/locations in a text

88B56DF80D4B41BEA6C1295C079EEA14.description: identify characters as people or animals in a text

C3E577AFF8BE44318A63E4212E2879B1.description: identify illustrations as pictures from a story

18C7C426C4D24996A6302EB42926FAF1.description: Use illustrations or concrete objects that relate to a story’s characters or setting.

7FB42B9A163F4EAEB0AE29CE03C8BB17.description: Use illustrations, concrete objects or text to identify details, characters, setting or events/plot from a story.

F2771BD865F040F98033699D5B76EE94.description: Use illustrations and text to describe the characters, setting or events/plot from a story.

F5E8A69492BE40D596D0B8204772282A.description:
Use information
gained from the illustrations
and words in a print or
digital text to demonstrate
understanding of its
characters, setting, or plot.

B963C642C3CD40E2BDFDAE7D489A46DC.description: Actively engage with one or more character voices.

9EC6B63066694962875C20B4D28FAED4.description: Actively engage with the person telling the story.

CCB1FFDE963B4AFB97F257566CD5D9B4.description: Match pictures or objects to identify who is telling a story.

EDDF99E49EB94867A0487B005DBEA268.description: Identify the point of view or attitude of main character.

DCD21C14D3C14878A674F60409477211.description: Identify the point of view or attitude of various characters

D27BF3CC161C40EBB6D0C29D36C00850.description:
Distinguish between
points of view when referring
to narrators and characters,
recognizing when the narrator
is a character in the story.

FE6FBC12023C4D039CB3CA4C525C5A0E.description: Actively engage in stories told with a distinctive beginning and end.

1A36B2F9415A438EAA899A66D6E700E9.description: model the ending of a conversation with a conclusion

90BC448DE1964E75B59BA959AE2CDDC6.description: model the beginning of a conversation with introduction

F316286E8B214C418C0EC96E5B4215CB.description: define beginning and end using many contextual examples

FDB45763EC7846FF911DC1E54531300E.description: Show the beginning and ending of a story.

F25782FB1C584CBEA53F9259D1531710.description: Identify words or phrases commonly used at the beginning or end of a story

06436C4250B8491B832394CBCC51A563.description: Describe what happens at the end of the story.

7165E9C4358B42E3A8B54D4C3EA1F5D7.description:
Describe the overall
structure of a story, including
describing how the beginning
introduces the story and the
ending concludes the action.

1BF7A95EA5604EA4A403A512D4CE0D48.description: Actively engage with music, poems, and stories with regular beats, alliterations, rhymes, and repeated lines.

078F40B6324B4E7198E52D8E716F69C5.description: identify words with the same number of syllables or beats

87B5C48933764CC5B8137BAEBF325C1B.description: name words that begin or end with the same sound

6A7E454AC5A5475AA042830D33124BA8.description: pair kinesthetic movements with regular beats, alliteration, rhymes, and repeated lines

5CD435D4F51D47749EFB51332BE353E2.description: sing songs with regular beats, alliteration, rhymes, and repeated lines

513B336F69774D7F89EC6B0EC81603EC.description: Break words from stories, songs or poems into syllables or beats

384AA55296C14A279A7C30BF42A392CF.description: Identify a sound that is repeated in an alliteration poem, song or story.

194EDF3919D240018377357DE5F2D456.description: Select words from stories, songs or poems that have the same number of syllables.

36275A26653545008BABE31D8F64C8A5.description: Select words that rhyme from stories, songs or poems

C6069A592E7C4FDBB5C43DA822AB13D9.description: Identify words that repeat, rhyme or support the rhythm in a story, poem or song

2B9B984D898540DBB03D11F3B2761EEB.description:
Describe how words
and phrases (e.g., regular
beats, alliteration, rhymes,
repeated lines) supply rhythm
and meaning in a story, poem,
or song.

D257DC2682F74EE58C028492107261A0.description: Actively engage during the sharing of any story.

4B76A4B099104E82A1EE2F650DE47104.description: Select characters, in a given story.

ECE182A315454B918FFC6DF4FA058DAD.description: Match character with an event or challenge from the story.

43BBE8826A034A9D8661471E92920A45.description: Describe characters and how they change in a story (e.g., sad to happy, short to tall).

981F99ACAA2E4710BF2696D274B1C2E6.description:
Describe how
characters in a story
respond to major events and
challenges.

E2AC2F419A7F469498FED4321DF5E599.description: Actively engage in shared folktales or fables.

4C57C774838A4B628984553A9630D2EC.description: explore common threads between morals and rules

E2BF027CB82F4B93AEA3DAE46646E634.description: explore the culture of origin for folktales and fables

6D7E27357ABE42AFACA6C622F107D58A.description: align morals with social situations, safety, life skills

C6EE1F024397450A9BB8E5E5B467AA3D.description: identify characteristics of folktales and fables (once upon a time…, talking animals, long ago, magic, good vs. evil, etc.)

1BFA7DB841DB4795996152D5FF362FFA.description:
Select two objects or pictures that represent two events from a familiar folktale or fable. explore how texts can teach lessons/
morals

74F5D29AF2DE4E6DA7F82BE70614888D.description: Retell or sequence events from a familiar folktale or fable to demonstrate recall.

043E58EA650D45E68096DE7E2285C733.description: Select the moral of a well-known folktale or fable from an array. (pictures with text)

BBBC3886FA8F4D1B85069A7F483DEC9F.description:
Analyze literary text
development.
a. Determine the lesson or
moral.
b. Retell stories, including
fables and folktales from
diverse cultures.

043B1BCE36084156A2845A4778CE070E.description: Actively engage with someone who is asking a question.

9DE9EB89D7CC41629E01B94EAC2AEA83.description: take note of details as the text is shared - note with objects, pictures, words, symbols, etc

4F15947BA809413A83BE721ADD83174A.description: associate when questions with time or plot sequence - order

02698B6C76A94DF9B094C4C23EBE3D27.description: associate where questions with setting or location

D24F0386B9A146A2B2E9A53F3C014A77.description: Answer who or what questions to demonstrate understanding of literature.

DE67CAD0316F4A16B281676E626DE5E0.description: Ask and answer who, what, where or when questions to demonstrate understanding of literature.

AEF5D1A6E306462A8ED7588CB1A60815.description: Ask and answer who, what, where, when or how questions to demonstrate understanding of literature

BE3B24102AF24EB191B7981271707AEF.description:
Ask and answer such
questions as who, what,
where, when, why, and how to
demonstrate understanding of
key details in a text.
